content: Hai un backup recente del profilo di Thunderbird? Che dimensione ha il tuo archivio di posta sul disco?
creator: @next

content: la cartella Profili e di circa 43GB la cartella mail allinterno circa 38GB. non ho un backup recente, Potrei cominciare a svuotare un po di cartelle se questo è il problema
creator: luciano7

content:
43 GB è una enormità. Ovviamente se c'è roba che NON ti serve conviene sempre svuotare.

Prima però Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content: Anche se esegui Thunderbird in modalità risoluzione dei problemi? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird
creator: @next

content:
Depends upon what you are being asked for...

If you have set up to use 'Primary Password' in Thunderbird then it will ask for the 'Primary Password' at the start of each session.

The 'Primary Password' has nothing to do with mail account passwords. It should never be set up to use a mail account password or a user account password - it's important the Primary Password is unique. People may choose to set up a 'Primary Password' because not only do they sgare a computer with other people but they also share or allow other people to use their computer User Account. Hence they need to stop prying eyes being able to see their stored mail account passwords.

Info On Primary Passwords https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

If you have not set up to use a 'Primary Password' and you are being asked to enter a mail account password. At prompt you enter the mail account password, then make sure you select the 'Remember Password' checkbox before you click on 'OK' Then the password should get stored in Thunderbird in this location:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll down to 'Passwords' section
  • Click on 'Saved Passwords' button
  • Click on 'Show Passwords' button
  • If 'Windows Security' window asks for password - when you start up computer and it asks for password to logon to desktop - that is the password you need to enter.
  • If you set up 'Primary Passwords' then it will ask for the 'Primary Password'

Check the lines for incoming and smtp outgoing: imap://account....or 'mailbox://account... and the smtp://account... Is the stored password correct ? It must be the same password you use to logon to see webmail

If anything is wrong right click on the relevant line and select 'Edit Username' and/or 'Edit Password' as required.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
È qualcosa che dovresti chiedere al supporto di BitDefender. Thunderbird conserva tutte le mail e gli allegato di una sua cartella in un singolo file, per tale motivo un intervento dell'antivirus può essere devastante danneggiando un file che può contenere anche migliaia di messaggi. È peraltro un intervento del tutto inutile poiché codificati nel formato mbox di Thunderbird anche eventuali virus sono del tutto innocui a meno che l'utente ne li salvi ed esegua volutamente.

Se la mail non è rilevante e può essere eliminata, probabilmente ti basta fare un po' di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content:
The log shows that the filter is not being triggered.

Do any of your filters have a "Stop filter execution" instruction?
creator: mozilla98

content: To clarify, such an instruction would be under the "Perform these actions:" section, correct? If so, I am not seeing a "Stop Filter Execution" instruction in any of my filters.
creator: ezequielm

content:
Correction: Apparently, if a filter runs but does not take any actions, no entry is written in the log. So we don't know if your filter is running or not.

Do you want all your filters to operate on the same folder, e.g., one in-box?

In the main message filter window, what is the setting for what folder the filters should operate on?

Sometimes the order of operation makes a difference. You could try disabling all filters except one troublesome filter and seeing if it works, or moving it to the top of the filter list and see if it works.

Other than that, this is about all I can offer: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters#w_move-to-a-folder

Maybe someone else can help more.

content:
All top level threads get sorted as per your 'View' > 'Sort by' settings: eg: Date, descending, threaded

However, all emails contained within a thread are appended in the order received as if a conversation. So in effect newest is always at the bottom.

The quick and easy way to locate new unread mail is to use 'Quick Filter' toolbar. Clickon the 'envelope' icon which has tooltop 'Show only unread messages' After reading, click on same icon again to revert to your normail view.

All top level threads that receive new mails within a thread become underlined to draw attention to the fact they contain unread mail.

So, to answer your question, no they cannot be reversed in order.

However, you can also right click on top level thread and select 'Open' > 'Open message in conversation' This opens in a new tab and shows all the conversation including any replies you may have made which may be of use. In that view you can remove the threads option and sort by Date. Thus putting entire conversation in the order desired. It also helps to see the conversation without all the clutter. Then just close the tab when finished or leave open to return to later.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I understand; thank you for the help. How could I submit a suggestion to implement this change? Thank you again.
creator: ezequielm

content:
ezequielm said
I understand; thank you for the help. How could I submit a suggestion to implement this change? Thank you again.

There has been several enhancement requests/bug reports asking for this to be implemented over many years and I can tell you there has not been anything forthcoming from the developers. All the code in Thunderbird has recently been completely rewritten and it was not included.

I get the impression this is not so simple a request as it sounds and they prefer to keep using the 'conversation' mode.

Bug report: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=479969
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Okay, thank you for the information. I'll submit a ticket, just in case, but I'll de-thread my e-mails for now. Thank you again.
creator: ezequielm

content:
podgik_sw said
How to set up an account in Thunderbird. I entered the address and password I use to log in via the Firefox browser and received the following message: Login to the imap.poczta.onet.pl server using the username xxx failed. What should I do?

Are you using these settings?

incoming IMAP: imap.poczta.onet.pl, 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = full email address

outgoing SMTP: smtp.poczta.onet.pl, 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, User Name = full email address

https://pomoc.poczta.onet.pl/baza-wiedzy/pop3-i-imap/

Disable a VPN if one is used. Depending on the app, you might also have to disable the antivirus.

content:
info.pjlkmv said
Hello In Thunderbird computer First use / Configure your existing email address / after filling in "Full name" then "Email address" then "Password" and selecting "IMAP" the following error message appears: "Unable to connect to the server. The configuration, username or password are incorrect". Could this be because the email address is configured with two-factor authentication (2FA)? If so, how should I proceed? All my email addresses are configured with two-factor authentication (2FA). Kind regards

Who is the mail provider? For some, such as gmail that use OAuth2 authentication, 2FA is neither necessary or recommended. Other providers might or might not recommend it, apart from whether it will work with TB.
